citations.narrative:
At least four dogs were observed not to have identification tags assigned to them. Official identification is required and
can be important to keep track of each dog's health information. Ensure that each adult dog is assigned an identification
tag that is affixed to the animal's neck by means of a collar made of material generally considered acceptable to pet
owners as a means of identifying their pet dogs or cat.
***Correct by September 20, 2024.

Ten new dogs acquired in the facility were not recorded on APHIS 7005. The licensee had the address from where dogs
were acquired available but all adult dogs must be recorded with complete information on APHIS 7005. An up to date
inventory of dogs on hand (APHIS 7005) is required and can be important for animal health tracking. Ensure that APHIS
7005 is kept up to date to maintain the required information for dogs on hand.
***Correct by September 1, 2024.

Three enclosures have flapper doors to go outside but the outdoor runs have not been built yet. The flapper doors are not
well secured; some boards are wedged against them but the boards are getting old and could also get knocked over
which could then allow the dogs to get out of their primary enclosure. Ensure that these flapper doors are well-secured to
prevent the dogs from getting out unattended.
***Correct by Aug 24, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(1) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
At least four dogs were observed not to have identification tags assigned to them. Official identification is required and 
can be important to keep track of each dog's health information. Ensure that each adult dog is assigned an identification 
tag that is affixed to the animal's neck by means of a collar made of material generally considered acceptable to pet 
owners as a means of identifying their pet dogs or cat. 
***Correct by September 20, 2024. 
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Ten new dogs acquired in the facility were not recorded on APHIS 7005. The licensee had the address from where dogs 
were acquired available but all adult dogs must be recorded with complete information on APHIS 7005. An up to date 
inventory of dogs on hand (APHIS 7005) is required and can be important for animal health tracking. Ensure that APHIS 
7005 is kept up to date to maintain the required information for dogs on hand.  
***Correct by September 1, 2024. 
3.6(a)(2)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Three enclosures have flapper doors to go outside but the outdoor runs have not been built yet. The flapper doors are not 
well secured; some boards are wedged against them but the boards are getting old and could also get knocked over 
which could then allow the dogs to get out of their primary enclosure. Ensure that these flapper doors are well-secured to 
prevent the dogs from getting out unattended. 
***Correct by Aug 24, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
